Added a little something for you.

Long range mages often have the inherent weakness of getting gap-closed.

AD assassins like Zed could rush maw and be a mage's worst nightmare, and even with adcs it proves to be an extremely powerful item due to the passive shield and great stats.

Zed is supposed to be a  most mages worse nightmare, as is any Assassin. For some reason people believe assassins are supposed to only kill Adc's. If it weren't for assassins what other class could ever even close the gap to pose a threat to mages.
Zed isn't supposed to be a nightmare to mages bud. Most mages should be able to be his nightmare, but with his stupid kit plus Duskblade and Maw, he's too stupid broken.

Sorry mages are too safe from every other class in the game. Any bruiser or Juggernaut will get kited to death. ADC's get out ranged, and tanks and supports can only hope to find a way to engagne on one in the  back line and hope for follow up. Assassins are literally the only class that pose a real threat to mages.
In my opinion mages should be the threats to assassins.

Tanks should be the threats to assassins. Their job is to dive in to kill squishies*, whereas a Tank's job is to peel and CC lock these mobile targets down long enough for their carries to kill them.


*yes, that includes mages as well - and this is coming from a mostly immobile mage player
Soooo how can mages kill an assassin that's locked down if they have maw?

Therein lies the value of the maw/sterak's nerfs. They're too good ATM compared to mages' rush item against ad assassins (Zhonyas) - and that's not even because hourglass is bad (if a tad overpriced) but because maw is so stupidly good lol
Can someone explain why the price of hourglass randomly changed from 500 something to 1050 today? What happened? I really don't know.
Riot felt that the active on Zhonya's was so good, it was a steal at 500 gold.
It wasn't just today iirc it was a couple if patches ago when riot decided that ap itemisation was too good and increased the base prices of a bunch of ap items

Duskblade is pretty average.  And no mages arent supposed to 1v1 Assassins.  Sorry you think your champs should be gods in 1v1s and teamfights cant have it all bud.

I agree to an extent.  The whole purpose of assassin's is to kill people who are on their own or to punish mistakes in a sense.  But yeah I do agree some mage are able to 1v1 assassin's fairly well, I just don't believe mages as a class are meant to be 1v1ing assassins.

Except mages is too much of a widespread class to be ''only one class''.

You have siege mages, frontline mages, utility mages, sustained damage mages.

Frontline mages are basically assassin counters most of the time. Or should.

Hi, my name is {{champion:90}} .

Truth is mages as a whole are a very diverse lot. Yeah, Karthus shouldn't have 1v1 potential, but to say ''NO MAGE CAN OUTDUEL AN ASSASSIN'' when several already exist... well, that is silly.

To me, yes they are. And duskblade has in my opinion made Zed even more of a broken champ than he already is. Unless you've seen a Zed with Duskblade, Maw, Bloodthirster, Merc Treads, Sterak's and Merc's Simitar take out over half of a full tank Nasus's health like I have, don't call duskblade "average".

Sounds like a terrible build, doubtful that's how you saw it happen.  If a Zed and Nasus are both 6 Items Zed wont even touch Nasus especially not with a build that terrible.  You expect to even scratch a Nasus without a last whisper?  Nasus literally face tanks all your damage and Q's you to death.  That build lacks Youmuus, and Last whisper and trades it out for life steal (which is terrible), Duskblade also procs right off the first auto so unless Nasus was very low from the beginning you aren't going to be doing any damage.  I understand that you hate Zed just like the average player that visits the boards would, but please try to not make up these ridiculous scenarios in your head and attempt to use them as proof for why Duskblade is broken on Zed.  Duskblade is just an average item, Pros dont even waste their time building it.

Dude. I fucking saw it with my own eyes. I was in the game. Zed jumped on Nasus, both of them full health. So don't try to make me out as a liar.

I have seen every Zed build Duskblade and it drastically helps his stupid power. I've seen Lee's and Riven's build it for pete's sake.

And... first of all you're level 20.
People aren't even good at that level really.
Why do I know? Because I recently was at that level too, and I wasn't that good either.
It's not someone's good, it's that others are bad, most of the time.
I'm level 30 now and I'm still not that good.

And after looking through your match history, you conveniently left out any mention of games when an enemy Zed did awful/neutral/etc. And after looking through for a while, I can't even find a single game log where an enemy Zed did well. And no, you are not telling the complete truth.

Zed does not just delete tanks without significant reason at which point you have nothing to complain about.

Actually when I was adjusting to Zed and practicing him I incidentally deleted a fed bruiser lee sin in a single combo using duskblade of draktharr and blade of the ruined King. It's entirely possible for zed to obliterate a tank if he has built enough damage into his kit and all in'd with his entire kit.

If the tank is ahead though or has lots of armour built, Zed wouldn't be able to do it.
Exactly.
Duskblade does around 8% missing hp to a tank that has built armor. How the fuck is that even relevant?

Dude. It was on my main account, you rude person. Not on this one. I'm a smurf.

Mainly in my games, I ban the atrocity named Zed, so that's why he's not in them. 

I'm a good player, just going through a rough patch. So don't be mean and say I'm "bad" and call me out on my level. That's rude and mean.

He got fed then, at that point.
Any champ does well if they get that fed that early.
And if his Q was enough to kill you, no, it was not a oneshot unless you're extremely squishy. He'd have done damage besides just the Q first.
